Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body and two large side-lugs, the left one in the form of a dolphin. The wide filling-hole is surrounded by a double moulding. The raised circular base is defined by a groove and flat below. The shoulder is decorated with an impressed vine pattern. The flat-topped splayed nozzle has a curved tip and is flanked by volutes. The handle is decorated with a vine leaf with a bearded wreathed mask in the centre. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q602)
